articles.author: Julia Harte, Daniel Trotta, Brad Brooks
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's address to Congress received high marks from a group of voters who backed the president in November's election, saying in interviews they supported his promises to cut taxes, reshape the government and crack down on immigration.
articles.title: Combative Trump declares 'America is back'. Here's what his voters made of it

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Angelo Amante, David Latona
articles.description: Some on Europe's far right are torn about Trump's dressing-down of Zelenskiy and his seeming indifference to the perceived threat Putin poses.
articles.title: Trump-Zelenskiy clash exposes divisions in Europe's rising far right

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: A divided U.S. Supreme Court declined on Wednesday to let President Donald Trump's administration withhold payment to foreign aid organizations for work they already performed for the government as the Republican president moves to pull the plug on American humanitarian projects around the world.
articles.title: US Supreme Court won't let Trump withhold payment to foreign aid groups

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Pope Francis, who has been struggling to overcome double pneumonia for almost three weeks, remained in stable condition throughout the day on Wednesday and has not had any new breathing crises, the Vatican said.
articles.title: Pope Francis in stable condition, resumes some work, Vatican says

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has paused all military aid to Ukraine following his clash with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy last week, a White House official said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump halts all U.S. military aid to Ukraine, White House official says

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Erin Banco
articles.description: The U.S. has paused intelligence-sharing with Ukraine, CIA Director John Ratcliffe said on Wednesday, piling pressure on Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to cooperate with U.S. President Donald Trump in convening peace talks with Russia.
articles.title: US cuts intelligence for Ukraine, adding pressure for peace deal

articles.author: Marc Jones
articles.description: With President Donald Trump's suspension of U.S. military aid to Ukraine, European nations are again looking at how to utilise some $300 billion of Russian state assets frozen by the Group of Seven rich democracies after Moscow's 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Explainer: How the West uses Russia's frozen reserves to help Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump asked Hamas militants to immediately release all hostages held in Gaza in what he called his "last warning" to them while also urging the group's leadership to leave the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Trump urges Hamas to release hostages in Gaza in what he calls 'last warning'

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: France and Britain are aiming to finalise with Ukraine, possibly "in days", a peace plan to present to the United States, while building bridges between the U.S. and Ukraine before possible talks in Washington, diplomats said.
articles.title: Britain, France refine Ukraine peace plan with new Washington trip in mind

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Hundreds of diplomats at the State Department and U.S. Agency for International Development have formally written to Secretary of State Marco Rubio protesting the dismantling of USAID, saying its dismantling undermines U.S. leadership and security and leaves power vacuums for China and Russia to fill.
articles.title: Hundreds of US diplomats join letter to Rubio to protest dismantling of USAID
